title: Is Mobalytics bannable?
body:
I can't seem to find the answer to this question anywhere.
It seems that all the software does is access the API for data on you and the other players in your games and gives you some information about them.
Has there been any word from Riot about this?
Phylol uses it and recommends it on his stream but I don't know whether to trust that or not.

replies.body: its about as bannable as look at op.gg

Really, the determining factor would be whether it interacts directly with, or otherwise influences, the game/client itself. Whether that's to influence the gameplay, such as taking advantage of an exploit, or changing some of the visual aspects of the game, such as replacing splash art, map art, adding custom champion skins etc. then that is something that can, and probably will, get you banned.

If all it does is access information available through the API, chances are you'd be fine. That kind of information is already available through services such as op.gg, lolking, mobafire and the like, so, as Nightjar has already stated, Riot doesn't consider it an unfair advantage.

not really bannable, alot of people use it or it's competitors and riot's stance on it, is if you could access the information from something like op.gg, then it's not an unfair advantage.

However riot's stance on every external program is, it might be allowed, it might follow riot's rules and be fair, but if they accidentally ban you for it, well sucks to be you.

I'd say it's overall safe though.
